paragraphs.text: Killer toys are fictional characters based on toys, dolls or puppets that come alive and commit violent or scary acts. Reasons for these actions have included possession by demons, devils, monsters, ghosts, supernatural creatures, dark magic, and malevolent or malfunctioning technology.

paragraphs.title: Concept
paragraphs.text:
Toys coming to life is a common and historical concept in children's literature,[1] and the idea has been adapted into numerous horror films and other horror fiction. The 1945 film Dead of Night represents a key inspiration for subsequent films such as Magic, while the subgenre's best-known films are the Child's Play films.[2][3]

Several works have used ventriloquist's dummies as antagonists, with the dummies either being outlets for their operator's psychosis, or acting malevolently on their own.[4]
